answers.answer: Me! Unfortunately.Was diagnosed at 6 weeks pregnant (guess it was preexisting, but never tested positive before despite my endo's best efforts).  I've been on insulin since 3 1/2 months.  Just recently getting hard to control my blood sugar even with the insulin....Hang in there.  Hope you get away with it this time as well.
I failed my 1 hr glucose last week and had my 3 hr sating test this monday which I passed..You would get lucky this time too..

Thanks Girls!!  I've never had to worry about it and really thought I would pass the 1 hour, but I was wrong :(Sorry to hear you've been on Insulin for so long :(  I have a friend of mine that is 14 weeks along and they just gave her the 3 hour to see if she'd past it.  So She'll probably end up like you.  Good luck

Insulin is not so bad.  The idea of doing it worse than the actual fact.  Testing blood sugar so often is more of a nuisance than injecting insulin. And it's all ok as long as baby is fine at the end of this.

my aunt failed her one hour test and then passed her 3 hour one.  she thinks it is because she ate breakfast too close to the test.  so with the 3 hour test, she did not eat before it.i just took my one hour one and passed it.
I just got my call back today and I PASSED!!!  WOOOHOOOO....I was just worried~I know i had the same thing happen with my twin pregnancy two years ago, but it's scary everytime :)Thanks girls!!
Yay!  I just read the thread.  I am happy for you :D
One less thing to worry about!      :)

question: I failed my 1 hour test (as I did with my twins)...and this Saturday I go back for my 3 hour test.  I have to be there at 7am (drink that orange drink again) and leave about 11am...SO CRAZY!  I'm hoping i get lucky like I did with the last pregnancy and pass the three hour.I was wondering if anyone here has gestational diabetes?
title: Anyone fail the 1 hour glucose?
